speaker: SCULLY
line: I, Dana Katherine Scully, swear to tell the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth, so help me God. I would like to read from a prepared statement.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: You may do so.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I left behind a career in medicine to become an FBI agent four years ago because I believed in this country. Because I wanted to uphold its laws, to punish the guilty and to protect the innocent. I still believe in this country. But I believe that there are powerful men in the government who do not.

speaker: SCULLY
line: . . . men who have no respect for the law and who flout it with impunity.

speaker: CHAIRMAN ROMINE
line: Ms. Scully. . .

speaker: SCULLY CONTINUES
line: I have come to the conclusion that it is no longer possible. . .

speaker: CHAIRMAN ROMINE
line: Agent Scully- - this is not a soapbox, Miss Scully. Your statement will be entered into the record.

speaker: SCULLY
line: With all due respect, Mr. Chairman, I would like to finish.

speaker: CHAIRMAN ROMINE
line: This is not why we are here today.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then why are we here, sir?

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Agent Scully, do you or do you not know the whereabouts of Agent Mulder? Are you or are you not aware of Agent Mulder's present location?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I respectfully decline to answer that question, sir.

speaker: CHAIRMAN ROMINE
line: Ms. Scully, you cannot refuse to answer that question.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because I believe answering that question could endanger Agent Mulder's life.

speaker: CHAIRMAN ROMINE
line: You don't seem to understand. Your response is not optional; you are an agent of the FBI.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then if I could please finish my statement. . . that it is no longer possible to carry out my duties as an FBI agent.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Are you tendering your resignation, Ms. Scully? Is that what you're trying to say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, sir. What I am saying is that there is a culture of lawlessness that has prevented me from doing my job. That the real target of this committee's investigation should be the men who are beyond prosecution and punishment. The men whose policies are behind the crimes that you are investigating.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Either you tell us what you know about Agent Mulder's whereabouts, or you will be held in Contempt of Congress.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Agent Scully?

speaker: FIRST CUSTOMS AGENT
line: Where are you coming from?

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: Japan

speaker: FIRST CUSTOMS AGENT
line: Did you travel anywhere else?

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: The Republic of Georgia.

speaker: FIRST CUSTOMS AGENT
line: The purpose of your trip?

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: Government business.

speaker: FIRST CUSTOMS AGENT
line: Okay, I'm going to ask you to see the customs official right through those doors.

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: What for? I'm traveling on a United States diplomatic visa.

speaker: FIRST CUSTOMS AGENT
line: Random check, sir. Please proceed through those doors.

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: I've got a connecting flight.

speaker: FIRST CUSTOMS AGENT
line: Right through those doors, sir.

speaker: SECOND CUSTOMS AGENT
line: Right over here, sir.

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: I don't know what this is about. I have diplomatic papers. I can't be treated like this.

speaker: SECOND CUSTOMS AGENT
line: Is that your only piece of luggage sir?

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: Yes.

speaker: SECOND CUSTOMS AGENT
line: Can you open it for me?

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: No.

speaker: SECOND CUSTOMS AGENT
line: Sir, I'm not offering it as a choice. Open the briefcase, or we'll open it for you.

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: I don't have the combination.

speaker: SECOND CUSTOMS AGENT
line: Vince, I need a strip and full body cavity search of this man.

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: There's going to be hell to pay for this treatment.

speaker: SECOND CUSTOMS AGENT
line: Sir, would you mind telling me what kind of diplomatic work you do, sir, and what material you're transporting in these?

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: Those are filled with biohazardous materials.

speaker: SECOND CUSTOMS AGENT
line: Then where's the paperwork? And why aren't the containers marked?

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: Don't open those, whatever you do -- that material cannot be exposed to --

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: Listen to me!

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: Open this door! Somebody open this door!

speaker: SECOND CUSTOMS AGENT
line: What the hell is this?

speaker: FIRST COURIER
line: Oh my god! Somebody open this door! Let me out of here! Let me out of here!

speaker: MULDER
line: We can't go in too soon. We have to be patient, it'll happen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What makes you so sure?

speaker: MULDER
line: I've received receipts over the past few weeks for detonation cord, for racing and diesel fuel, and for 80 bags of ammonium nitrate purchased in cash in three different states under three different signatures.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What makes you so sure that it's here -- that it's tonight?

speaker: MULDER
line: I've received two new receipts, one for first and last on this storage space, and one to rent a two-ton truck yesterday. Both with the same signatures. We could be looking at the next Oklahoma City.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, so who do you think's leaking them, and why are they leaking them to you?

speaker: SWAT GUY
line: : We got traffic.

speaker: SWAT GUY
line: They're leaving.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hold it. agent, I'm armed! Exit the vehicle, now!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Driver's dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: I counted two men.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get out of the truck.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get out of the truck!

speaker: MULDER
line: Let me see your hands! Hands in the air!

speaker: MULDER
line: You son of a bitch!.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I handed you this bust, Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, come on, Krycek!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Who do you think sent you those receipts?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Most of the detonation cord was stolen from a construction site, and some of the explosives were just taken from a military base. I mean, security's just so lax, it's a joke --

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Most everything else was over the counter. Two thousand kilos of boom-boom.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How'd you get involved with these men?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: They found me in North Dakota. They liberated me on a salvage hunt.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Hey, you go underground, you gotta learn to live with the rats.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sure you had no trouble adapting.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: These men are pathetic revolutionaries who'll kill innocent Americans in the name of bonehead ideologies.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're full of crap, Krycek. You're an invertebrate scum-sucker whose moral dipstick is about two drops short of bone dry.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Hey! I love this country.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you want, Krycek?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Same thing you do. To find the man who tried to kill me. The same man that was responsible for your father's death... your sister's.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You want this man brought to justice?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You can't bring these men to justice. They're protected. The laws of this country protect them in the name of national security. They know no law.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then why don't you put a bullet in his head like you did that man out there?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: These men, they fear one thing; exposure.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You expose *him,* you expose his crimes, you destroy the destroyer's ability to destroy.

speaker: MULDER
line: The only thing that will destroy this man is the truth.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: The truth, the truth! There's no truth. These men, they make it up as they go along. They're the engineers of the future. They're the real revolutionaries. I can get them for you too.

speaker: MULDER
line: We can't help you Krycek.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Mulder. This is just one bomb I'm sitting on here. You didn't ask me how many more I know about.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What flight is he on?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: It's an international charter that originated in Russia. Turkish airline.

speaker: MULDER
line: There it is, Air Lacayo, 6:45. Fifteen minutes ago. Come on, let's go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He still has to go through customs.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: No. He'll be carrying a diplomatic pouch.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: That's him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, federal agent. Don't be alarmed; I just need to speak with you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stop! Stop right there! Sir! Mulder!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, look.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is this some kind of joke?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Show him.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Expose it for him, Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did you get for Halloween, Charlie Brown?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Who is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: I need to speak with you, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What do you want, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I need your authorization to provide a safe house.

speaker: SKINNER
line: A safe house for whom?

speaker: MULDER
line: This man has information about extreme-right militia that could save the lives of innocent Americans.

speaker: SKINNER
line: He'll be safe here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Relatively safe. We're not even yet, boy. That's a start. Give me the keys.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You can't -- you can't leave me out here, I'm going to freeze to death!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Just think warm thoughts.

speaker: SACKS
line: I know I asked you earlier, but you have no idea where this came from?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not its origin, no.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you have an idea, don't you?

speaker: SACKS
line: This rock contains what are known as polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons fitting the approximate description of those in fragments of meteorite found in the ice fields of Antarctica.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you saying. . .

speaker: SACKS
line: What you're looking at is quite possibly from Mars. Over four billion years old.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is it valuable?

speaker: SACKS
line: Beyond adding evidence to the debate over the fossilized remains of alien bacteria, it's relatively worthless.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Does this rock contain fossilized remains, Dr. Sacks?

speaker: SACKS
line: Well, I won't know that until I'm able to take a core sample, which I very much hope you'll allow me to do.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think we'd all like to know what's in that rock.

speaker: CSM
line: I didn't realize you lived in this neighborhood, Mr. Skinner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I just moved in.

speaker: CSM
line: I'd guess you live on an upper floor? For the view?

speaker: SKINNER
line: What do you want from me?

speaker: CSM
line: Agents Mulder and Scully intercepted a diplomatic pouch here in Washington last night. I'm afraid it's created a problem in foreign policy circles. Quite a problem, actually.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't know anything about a diplomatic pouch.

speaker: CSM
line: No? Nothing about the matter?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No.

speaker: CSM
line: Well, I find that hard to believe. As their supervisory agent. As a friend, I should advise you, Mr. Skinner, that withholding information on matters of national security is punishable under the laws of this country for treason and sedition.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Thank you. I'll consider myself advised. As a friend.

speaker: CSM
line: I need that pouch, Mr. Skinner. And I need to know who gave them the order to intercept it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'll get back to you.

speaker: CSM
line: Wars have broken out over far less, Mr. Skinner. Far far less.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Got something?

speaker: MULDER
line: Big dead end at the State Department, but U.S. Customs officials detained another courier on a similar visa in Honolulu two nights ago. He was coming from Russian Georgia carrying some kind of toxic soil sample.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Toxic?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, which leads me to believe what's in this rock we intercepted are answers beyond the existence of extraterrestrial life. Even beyond the conspiracy to cover up that existence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, that rock contains fossils of what is believed to be alien bacteria, and even that is under intense debate.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why all this effort to get it onto U.S. soil? I think what Alex Krycek has given us is the pivotal piece to an even larger plot.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What he's given us, Mulder, is a rock. Alex Krycek is a liar, and a murderer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who wants to expose the same men that we do and will go to any lengths to succeed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What I'm worried about is you, Mulder and how far you'll go. And how far I can follow you.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder, where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm with Scully. We're on our way out to NASA-Goddard.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, I suggest that you turn around and head home. I don't know how I'm going to explain myself to the police.

speaker: MULDER
line: Explain yourself about what?

speaker: SKINNER
line: The police are at my place with a dead body. They want to talk to everyone in the building.

speaker: MULDER
line: Pull over here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm gonna take a cab.

speaker: MULDER
line: I want you to find out about that rock. Call me as soon as you do.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, I wasn't home.

speaker: DETECTIVE
line: And you live on what floor?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Seventeenth. Walter Skinner. I'm an Assistant Director with the FBI.

speaker: DETECTIVE
line: Oh. Oh, my apologies, I got some bad information from my lieutenant that there's a man hanging from your balcony.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're going to walk out of here like nothing happened. If anybody speaks to us, you say nothing.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I got no problem. You put me up here, man, I'm looking forward to seeing you get me out. Krycek by the front of his jacket, as if he's going to punch him)

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I got news for you, Mulder. When they find out who's dead on the ground down there, there's going to be no question whose apartment he was pulled out of.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who is he?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Same guy with the pouch.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I say follow the pouch.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me. Listen to me: whatever's in that rock, it appears to be lethal.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's Dr. Sacks. He's. . . I don't know, Mulder. I've never seen this before. I don't know if he's dead or alive.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you better find out. I want you to get me an address in New York. You're going to have to go through the Bureau to get that.

speaker: MARITA
line: Who is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Fox Mulder.

speaker: MARITA
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I need your help.

speaker: MARITA
line: How do you know where I live?

speaker: MULDER
line: FBI database. I'm sorry, it's a matter of extreme urgency. A diplomatic pouch left Russia and arrived here in the U.S. Two men are dead. I need to know why. LATER ON Thank you.

speaker: MARITA
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MARITA
line: The diplomatic pouch traveled an apex route to the Russian province of Krasnoyarsk.

speaker: MULDER
line: Krasnoyarsk?

speaker: MARITA
line: The point of entry was the city of Norilsk.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's just north of Tunguska.

speaker: MARITA
line: Tunguska?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: MARITA
line: What are you looking for?

speaker: MULDER
line: My cell phone. I gotta book myself on a flight to Krasnoyarsk, Russia.

speaker: MARITA
line: I can help you, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Find my cell phone?

speaker: MARITA
line: No. With cover credentials. A diplomatic passport. A visa.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why? Why are you helping me?

speaker: MARITA
line: Because I can. Because there are those of us who believe in you...believe in the search for the truth.

speaker: MULDER
line: How long will it take?

speaker: MARITA
line: How long do you have? Mulder waits.)

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Where have you been?

speaker: MULDER
line: Making travel arrangements.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: To go where?

speaker: MULDER
line: To follow the pouch.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You're going to keep me in the dark?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: These are Level 4 suits. Exactly what he's wearing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Contamination is impossible unless there's a tear or a loss of pressurization. So whatever happened to him, it's unlikely it penetrated the suit.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: What do you think happened? a closer look.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, there's a film over everything.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Looks like spray kicked off the saw blade when he was cutting into the rock.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh my God! This man's alive!

speaker: PENDRELL
line: He can't be. I mean he's not breathing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I think he is. I think he's in some kind of coma state or some kind of somatic rigor.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Due to what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know, I don't know, but we have to get him out of here.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Mulder, you're not --

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm leaving the window rolled down. If I'm not back in a week, I'll call Agent Scully to come bring you a bowl of water.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Mulder! You're not gonna leave me here! I got information, Mulder, about a second bomb! Time, date and place!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: ...Son of a bitch, get back here!

speaker: MULDER
line: What did you say to me?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: You called me a bad name.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: nan

speaker: KRYCEK
line: My parents were Cold War immigrants, what's it to you?

speaker: WMM
line: You've been putting on the miles.

speaker: CSM
line: It would help if you had a phone.

speaker: WMM
line: I come out here because there are no phones. What is it?

speaker: CSM
line: Our courier's dead.

speaker: WMM
line: Yes, I heard. Pushed out a window. Can this expose us?

speaker: CSM
line: No, of course not. Our necessary and plausible denial is intact.

speaker: WMM
line: Then what is your concern?

speaker: CSM
line: Last night, CIA airport intel had a man using UN credentials appear on their computers booked on a flight for Krasnoyarsk, Russia.

speaker: WMM
line: Who was it?

speaker: CSM
line: We haven't been able to determine that with any certainty yet, but it appears to be a man fitting the description of Fox Mulder.

speaker: WMM
line: You fool, you stupid fool! This must be corrected; this must be handled!

speaker: CSM
line: Well, of course it can be! You know my capabilities in a crisis.

speaker: WMM
line: I don't think you realize what's at stake here, what level this must be carried to. This will take more than just a good aim!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Senator Sorenson wants to see us?

speaker: SKINNER
line: That's usually what a letter of summons means, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, but a summons for what??

speaker: SKINNER
line: I can only guess, but the fact I'm named in the invitation with you and Agent Mulder leads me to believe I've been implicated in something far more serious than I already know.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How much more serious, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's hard to say.

speaker: SKINNER
line: More serious than harboring a known felon? What about Agent Mulder? What does he know?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder is endeavoring to get his own answers, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: He says it's about five kilometers through those woods.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's go.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You're really gonna keep me in the dark, aren't you? What are we doing here, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: June 30, 1908. Tungus tribesmen and Russian fur traders look up into the southeastern Siberian sky and see a fireball streaking to Earth. When it hit the atmosphere, it created a series of cataclysmic explosions that are considered to be the largest single cosmic event in the history of civilization. Two thousand times the force of the bomb that was dropped on Hiroshima.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What was it?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's been speculated that it was a piece of a comet, an asteroid, or even a piece of anti-matter. The power of the blast leveled trees in a radial pattern for 2000 kilometers. No real definitive evidence has ever been found to provide a satisfying explanation of what it was.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think somebody found that evidence. And the explanation is something that nobody ever dreamed of.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What are they doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Looks like some kind of mining camp.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh!

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think they're miners.

speaker: MULDER
line: Run!

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't speak Russian.

speaker: PRISONER
line: Then no one has told you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Told me what?

speaker: PRISONER
line: You were brought here to die. To wish you were dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: I wasn't brought here. I came here looking for something.

speaker: PRISONER
line: The only thing you will find here is death and suffering.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is this place?

speaker: PRISONER
line: This place? A gulag. A place where the guilty rule the innocent.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: We gotta get out of here. They're going to torture us.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you know?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: They were questioning me. Trying to get me to confess.

speaker: MULDER
line: To what?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: To being a spy.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did you tell them?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: That we were stupid Americans lost in the woods. Mulder, you're going to need me in here. Don't touch me again.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Ah, Agent Scully, Mr. Skinner, thank you for coming.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, it was difficult to decline an invitation from a member of Congress, Senator.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Please, have a seat. Are you familiar with the penalties for obstruction of justice?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that a rhetorical question, sir?

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: You know why you've been called here today?

speaker: SKINNER
line: We have an idea, Senator.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: We've been looking into the death of this man outside your apartment, Mr. Skinner, and it's raised some troubling questions.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Such as?

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: What this man was doing on your balcony before he fell to his death.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: It was your balcony, wasn't it, Mr. Skinner? Perjury is a very serious offense, particularly for an FBI agent.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We intend to file a complete report on this matter, sir, once we fully understand what it is that we're investigating.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: And Agent Mulder. . . can you explain to me why he declined my invitation to be here today?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder is in the field, sir, seeking answers to the questions you are asking.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: And where is he seeking these answers?

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Agent Scully?

speaker: APPROXIMATE TRANSLATION
line: nan

speaker: GUARD
line: Get up! Get up!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I want to see your supervisor.

speaker: GUARD
line: Why would my supervisor want to see you?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: He'll want to see me.

speaker: GUARD
line: I don't know...I don't know...

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you saying?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: That I want to see his supervisor.

speaker: GUARD
line: Okay, but if he doesn't want to see you, you'll be accountable.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I'll be accountable, I'll be accountable.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Da svidanya.

speaker: PRISONER
line: That man is not your friend. He speaks indifferently to the guards. Formal language, as if to an equal. You are deceived.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who are you?

speaker: PRISONER
line: A prisoner, like you, but I have committed no crime.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why are you here?

speaker: PRISONER
line: To do the work. Like the others. Like them, I will die in an experiment when there is no longer any use for me.

speaker: MULDER
line: What kind of experiment?

speaker: MULDER
line: NO!
